channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Says He’s ‘Just Gotten Started,’ and Anti-Tourism Tactics in Europe
After Nudge From Trump, Senate Sets Fast Pace in Confirming His Ambassadors
item.description: Republicans have raced to approve the president’s picks to serve as top diplomats around the globe, in some cases with solid backing from Democrats.

item.title: U.K. Joins U.S. in Strike Against Houthis in Yemen
item.description: There was no immediate comment from the American military about the joint operation, the first since President Trump took office.

item.title: President Trump says voters signed up for his economic policies—but consumer confidence is at its lowest in five years
item.description: President Trump said Americans signed up for some economic discomfort arising from tariffs when they voted him into the Oval Office.

item.title: France seeks small parcel fees as flows from China surge
item.description: France is pushing to slap fees on small packages from discount retailers including China’s Temu and Shein.

item.title: Hawaii plans to jack up hotel tax to 11% in first-of-its-kind move to pay for projects to cope with climate change
item.description: State leaders say they'll use the funds for projects like replenishing sand on eroding beaches, and removing invasive grasses like those that fueled t...

item.title: Spain Searches for Answers on What Caused Power Blackout
item.description: The country’s top officials are trying to figure out the cause of a power outage that stranded tens of millions of people across the Iberian Peninsula...

item.title: EU rules against U.S. Big Tech have offended Trump—but Microsoft pledges to protect the people of Europe amidst ‘geopolitical volatility’
item.description: Microsoft is expanding its data centre operations in 16 European countries and help build an artificial intelligence "ecosystem" on the continent.

item.title: Young People Are Not As Happy As They Used to Be, Study Finds
item.description: New data collected from more than 200,000 people across the world shows that young people aren’t as happy as they used to be.

item.title: 17 years after California voters approved $10 billion for high speed rail, no tracks have been laid
item.description: The project's price tag now exceeds $100 billion, more than triple the initial estimate.

item.title: U.K. Joins U.S. in Strike Against Houthis in Yemen
item.description: There was no immediate comment from the American military about the joint operation, the first since President Trump took office.

item.title: South Korea to Use Drones to Deter Birds After Deadly Jeju Air Crash
item.description: The government announced a raft of aviation safety measures after a Jeju Air crash late last year that killed 179 people, including upgrading airport ...

item.title: Ho Chi Minh City Celebrates the Fall of Saigon With a Parade
item.description: Surging Vietnamese nationalism appeared on the streets, as thousands gathered to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the end of the war.

item.title: Spain Searches for Answers on What Caused Power Blackout
item.description: The country’s top officials are trying to figure out the cause of a power outage that stranded tens of millions of people across the Iberian Peninsula...

item.title: 50th Anniversary Parade Marks End of Vietnam War
item.description: Veterans and young people alike commemorated the end of the Vietnam War with a 50th anniversary parade in Ho Chi Minh City on Wednesday.
